This app utilizes a light-weight embedded databasing system to store your car and part information. This section of the app is to give you a means of backing-up and restoring your information in.


It's important to backup your data so as to prevent a lose of what will sure to be, over time, a large accumulation of parts and their additional sources. This lose of your information could be due to the lose or damage of your phone or tablet.


Tap the E-mail button below to directly email us with your preference in cloud drive sites.


Read the Help in the drop-down menu above for more information.

Welcome to MyClassicCar.

This application is aimed at aiding classic car owners to help them keep track their car\'s maintenance and have a handy database of difficult to find parts for their cars with part numbers. Often times Parts Store databases don\'t go back much before the 1970\'s making it difficult to locate needed parts. With this app a person can supply a part number to a parts counter person for cross referencing. Making it easier to locate the needed part.

App Hierarchy
The App hierarchy is as follows:
● List of Vehicles.
 ● Oil change record for a specific Vehicle.
 ● Repair record for a specific Vehicle.
 ● List of parts for a specific Vehicle.
  ● List of additional Sources for
   a specific part over and above the
   vehicle manufacture.
Getting Started

To get started with your freshly loaded My Classic Car, tap the plus sign in the Home view and enter the basic information for your car, then tap save. The minimum information is \"Make\", \"Year\", and \"Oil Change Interval\" mileage. Enter as many cars as you would like. During the Save process you will be redirected back to the Home view, which is where a listing of cars is maintained. Once back in the Home view, tap on the cell for the car you want to add a part to or record a maintenance or oil change incident.

Oil and Maintenance Records

First tap on the desired car. Then tap on either the \"Oil Change Record\" button or the \"Oil Maintenance Record\" button. from there tap on the Plus Sign at the lower right side of the screen to enter a new record. These records are only editable after you enable editing from the drop down menu.

Parts Database

First tap on the desired car. Then tap on the \"Part Numbers\" button. From there tap the Plus sign at the lower right side of the screen to enter a part for this car \u2014 an indication of which car you are adding a part for will be posted in the toolbar at the top of the view. Tap on the Question Mark \"?\" at the top of the view for assistance and details on adding parts.

Making Changes to a Car

If you make a typo, you can correct it by tapping on the Car in the list in the Home view that needs the correction. At the top of the next view \u2014 which is the selection view \u2014 tap on the small Car icon in the toolbar. This will take you to the Car Info view. From this view tap on the pencil button to edit. Be sure to tap Save once you have finished editing.

Adding a Car

The fields here are generally self explanatory. The minimum requirement information for saving a car is \"Make\", \"Year\", and \"Oil Change Interval mileage\". (Mileage between oil changes)

Include a Photo

A photo can be included with your listing by tapping on the square, \"No Image Available\", at the top left corner of the view. This will activate the device camera. Try to center the car in the photo for the best possible thumbnail image. A photo is not requires for the entry of a car. After snapping a photo many camera apps will require you to tap a \"Save\" button, to accept the photo. Sometimes that \"Save\" button will be in the form of a check mark.

Be Sure to Save

Save your freshly entered car by simply tapping on the green button \u2014 the Save button \u2014 at the lower left of the view. Once saved you will be returned to the Home view where you will see your newly entered car.

Making Changes

If you make a typo, you can correct it by tapping on the car in the list in the Home view that needs the correction. From the next view \u2014 which is the Record Selection view \u2014 tap on the small car icon in the toolbar. This will take you to a view displaying your car\'s info. Now tap on the pencil button to edit. Be sure to tap Save once you have finished editing.

App Structure
The App hierarchy is as follows:
● List of Vehicles.
 ● Oil change record for a specific Vehicle.
 ● Repair record for a specific Vehicle.
 ● List of parts for a specific Vehicle.
  ● List of additional Sources for
   a specific part over and above the
   vehicle manufacture.

OEM Parts

The parts that are or will be presented here are intended to be parts from a car manufacture, often referred to as OEM parts. These can be seen as the \"root\" part, providing a listing for, lets say, an Air Filter. Once you have entered a part tap on the desired part you want to see the information for. It is in the next view you can add additional sources for that part.

Add an OEM Part

To add an OEM part tap on the plus sign and fill in the information you have. A Part Name is required for saving a part \u2014 Name-less parts are not permitted. A Part Number is NOT required for creating a part as original manufacture part numbers are often not easily obtainable. This will at least get a listing started for a part for this car \u2014 an indication of which car you are adding a part for will be posted in the toolbar at the top of the view. Be sure to tap the save button when you are finished.

If you didn\'t have the Part Number or other information at the time you created the OEM Part listing, you can add it later by edit the listing and adding the missing information. Check the help \"?\" in the next view for info on viewing and editing an OEM part.

Include a Photo

When adding or editing an OEM part, a photo can be included or changed by simply tapping on the photo square to activate the device camera. Many camera apps will require you to tap a \"Save\" button, to accept the photo. Sometimes that \"Save\" button will be in the form of a check mark.

Map to Existing OEM Parts

As an intended feature of this app, after you have entered more than one vehicle and OEM parts for those vehicles, you will offered the ability to map to an existing part already in storage. Tap on the plus sign to add a part as normal. If you choose \"Existing\" you will be presented with a full list of ALL parts in storage except for those already mapped to the particular vehicle you are seeking to add a part to.

The premise behind this feature is many cars from the same car manufacture, approximately the same age, will often use the same part on two different Models of the same brand of vehicles, and often two different brands from the same car manufacture. These listings will literally be the same exact part in storage, merely mapped to more than one car. So if you edit an OEM part while under a specific vehicle, that edit will also appear in the listing under the other vehicle(s) this part is mapped to. (So, no, you\'re not going crazy.)

This feature is intended to provide flexibility, save space in storage, prevent redundancies, and hopefully prevent confusion.

Add Additional Sources

Once an "OEM" part is created or mapped to a specific vehicle simply tap on the desired part listing to view its details. When viewing a parts details \u2014 Single Part view \u2014 tap on the Plus sign to enter additional sources for that part.

View OEM Part Info

To see the complete OEM part listing tap on either the Part Name or OEM Part Number fields to view all the part\'s details, including any added notes or details.

Edit OEM Part Information

To make a correction or alteration to an OEM part first view the part\'s details by tapping on either the Part Name or OEM Part Number fields, then tap on the pencil to edit. In Edit mode the photo can changed or added by tapping the photo to activate the camera. Be sure to tap Save when finished.

Delete an OEM Part

Tap on either the Part Name or OEM Part Number fields to enter the OEM Part details view. Once there, tap on the drop down menu in the toolbar \u2014 three vertical dots. In the drop down menu is a selection called \"Delete OEM Part\". This will delete the current OEM part and all of the additional sources listed for this part. Once deleted you will be redirected to the view listing the OEM parts for the current car less the one you just deleted. If this was a shared part it will only be un-mapped to this car and remain in storage and mapped to the other car(s) it was mapped to.

Add Additional Sources

Additional sources are places like Parts Stores, websites, and catalogs, To add an additional source for \"this\" part tap on the Plus sign. Add as many additional sources as you need to.

Information backup

This is the \"quick and dirty\" backup solution. Cloud backup solutions will be implemented once it is discovered which cloud drive backup solutions people want to use. E-mail pps@woodlandsoftwaresolutions.com with your preference of cloud drive sites by clicking the \"E-mail\" button on the Backup view.

How To Do a Backup

Simply tap the Backup button. A copy of the file where your information is stored will be placed in the Documents directory. This makes it possible to have access the database file that your app information is stored in. Use the File Manager that accompanies nearly all Android devices to look in Internal Storage for a file called \"carParts.db\". You will want to copy the \"carParts.db\" file to an off device drive website or location. You could e-mail yourself the file or perform a Share on it to an Internet Cloud drive site like Google Drive of DropBox. You will have the have the mobile app for your favorite cloud drive site installed on you device to do this.

Restoring your information

If you have changed devices because you are upgrading or because of lose or damage, you can restore your PPS data file by first returning your saved information file, \"carParts.db\", to your device by e-mailing it to yourself or by saving it to favorite cloud drive site and then exporting or saving it to the Download directory in Internal Storage. Most of the time you will not have a choice of where your file gets saved to on your device. It will most likely be copied to the Download directory, which is why the Download directory was setup in this app as the place where the Restore subroutine will go looking for your information file at. Simply tap the Restore button to restore your car and parts information to the app.

Do not alter your information file while it is in your chosen backup location as this will very likely cause inaccessibility to some or most of your stored information and possibly app crashes. Data corruption.

If you received a \"File Not Found\" error statement while trying to perform a Restore then your file is not in the correct location on your device. On many devices there is a Download directory on both your microSD card and in \"Device Storage\". You want one in the Device Storage, which is sometimes called Internal Storage. Use your device\'s File Manager app to copy the file to the correct location on your device\'s file system. This is currently the only way to restore your app information.
